code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:white female gold smith aged 53 years presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 24 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 25 mph on impact. pt c/o moderate nausea, severe headache, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 68 in, Weight 139 lbs, Temperature 97.7 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:53 YO white female gold smith presents for one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 24 min). she denies headache, vomiting and nausea since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. she consumes 2 drinks per night Patient does not smoke o:Height 69 in, Weight 142 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=95,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=42.1,Reaction Time=0.51, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,
